item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 17, 2024 at 3:00 AM UTC
item.description:
1. New LLM optimization technique slashes memory costs up to 75% (109 points | 24 comments)
2. Xiaomi Home Integration for Home Assistant (424 points | 229 comments)
3. Go Protobuf: The New Opaque API (182 points | 63 comments)
4. Settlement from Meta for Australian Users Impacted by Cambridge Analytica (8 points | 2 comments)
5. Lfgss shutting down 16th March 2025 (day before Online Safety Act is enforced) (410 points | 258 comments)
6. Making a watch from scratch (158 points | 26 comments)
7. Veo 2: Our video generation model (339 points | 163 comments)
8. In Search of a Faster SQLite (209 points | 83 comments)
9. Why is it so hard to buy things that work well? (2022) (503 points | 424 comments)
10. What did Ada Lovelace's program actually do? (2018) (210 points | 69 comments)
11. Advent of Code on the Nintendo DS (44 points | 13 comments)
12. Forgotten Collection of Charles de Gaulle's Manuscripts Discovered in a Safe (34 points | 1 comment)
13. Ruby Video – On a mission to index all Ruby conferences (162 points | 18 comments)
14. Ask HN: SWEs how do you future-proof your career in light of LLMs? (245 points | 511 comments)
15. Modelica (221 points | 70 comments)
16. U2's Larry Mullen Jr: my dyscalculia makes 'counting like climbing Everest' (38 points | 24 comments)
17. Alley Cat Remeow Edition (12 points | 3 comments)
18. Popeye and Tintin enter the public domain in 2025 along with Faulkner, Hemingway (228 points | 67 comments)
19. Using Guile for Emacs (124 points | 39 comments)
20. Our muscles will atrophy as we climb the Kardashev Scale (110 points | 152 comments)
21. Quick takes on the recent OpenAI public incident write-up (55 points | 13 comments)
22. A new twist: The molecular machines that loop chromosomes also twist DNA (10 points | 1 comment)
23. Show HN: NCompass Technologies – yet another AI Inference API, but hear us out (23 points | 27 comments)
24. Mirror bacteria research poses significant risks, scientists warn (135 points | 116 comments)
25. The Red Beads Experiment (5 points | discuss)
26. Converge (YC S23) is hiring founding engineer #2 ( | hide)
27. Principles of Educational Programming Language Design (28 points | 20 comments)
28. Absinthe: From green fairy to moral panic (36 points | 22 comments)
29. Kevin Langdon's 'Omni Magazine' unsupervised IQ test (1979) (12 points | 6 comments)
30. Backward-incompatible GRUB2 change causing BIOS setup bootloop (65 points | 12 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 17, 2024 at 3:00 AM UTC
